StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [SaveRecruiterInquiry]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
( @InquiryID uniqueiden..er, @RecruiterID uniqueiden..er, @InquiryTypeID int, @InquiryDate date.me, @Disposi.onID int, @Disposi.onDate date.me, @Ac.onID int, @UpdatedByUser uniqueiden..er ) AS BEGIN
BEGIN TRANSACTION
IF EXISTS(SELECT RecruiterInquiryID FROM [dbo].[RecruiterInquiry] WHERE [RecruiterInquiryID] = @InquiryID) BEGIN UPDATE [dbo].[RecruiterInquiry] SET [RecruiterID] = @RecruiterID, [InquiryTypeID] = @InquiryTypeID, [InquiryDate] = @InquiryDate, [InquiryDisposi.onTypeID] = @Disposi.onID, [Disposi.onDate] = @Disposi.onDate, [InquiryAc.onTypeID] = @Ac.onID, [UpdatedByUser] = @UpdatedByUser, [UpdateDate] = GETDATE() WHERE [RecruiterInquiryID] = @InquiryID END ELSE BEGIN INSERT INTO [dbo].[RecruiterInquiry] ( [RecruiterInquiryID], [RecruiterID], [InquiryTypeID], [InquiryDate], [InquiryDisposi.onTypeID], [Disposi.onDate], [InquiryAc.onTypeID], [UpdatedByUser], [UpdateDate] ) VALUES ( @InquiryID, @RecruiterID, @InquiryTypeID, @InquiryDate, @Disposi.onID, @Disposi.onDate, @Ac.onID, @UpdatedByUser, GETDATE() )
END
-- Rollback the transac.on if there were any errors IF @@ERROR <> 0 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('Error occurred while performing the change.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- Rollback the transac.on if the number of rows changed does not meet our expecta.on... IF @@ROWCOUNT > 1 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('An unexpected number of rows were changed.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- If we reach this point, the commands completed successfully. COMMIT TRANSACTION END
